articles.author: Daphne Psaledakis
articles.description: Russia has received ballistic missiles from Iran and will likely use them in Ukraine within weeks, U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken said on Tuesday, warning that cooperation between Moscow and Tehran threatens wider European security.
articles.title: Blinken says Russia received missiles from Iran, warns of threat to European security

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian officials said on Tuesday they shot down at least 15 drones around Moscow overnight in a wave of attacks that set residential buildings on fire, killed a woman and forced more than 30 flights in the capital to be suspended.
articles.title: Ukraine's drones target Moscow, more than 30 airline flights suspended, Russia says

articles.author: Mohammad Salem, Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli strikes blasted a huge crater in a designated safe zone in southern Gaza before dawn on Tuesday, setting tents ablaze and burying Palestinian families under sand.
articles.title: Dozens killed, wounded in Israeli strikes on Gaza tent camp

articles.author: Joseph Ax
articles.description: Republican U.S. presidential candidate Donald Trump and Democratic Vice President Kamala Harris will meet in their first and perhaps only debate on Tuesday, a clash that could prove pivotal in their pitched battle for the White House.
articles.title: Trump, Harris to clash at debate that could reshape 2024 race

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden said on Tuesday that his administration was "working that out now" when asked if the U.S. would lift restrictions on Ukraine's use of long range weapons in its war against Russia.
articles.title: Biden says ending ban on Ukraine's use of long-range weapons being worked out

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Mexican senators hurled insults on Tuesday in a tense session ahead of a vote on a controversial judicial reform, with opposition lawmakers accusing the ruling bloc of underhand tactics to ensure they secure the votes needed for its approval.
articles.title: Mexican senators hurl insults in discussion of judicial reform

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Executives from major tech firms like Google , Adobe , Microsoft and Meta Platforms will testify next week at a U.S. Senate Intelligence Committee hearing on election threats, Axios reported on Tuesday, citing sources.
articles.title: Tech firm executives to testify before US Senate about election threats, Axios reports

articles.author: Maayan Lubell
articles.description: Blood on the ground of a dark, cramped tunnel sealed by an iron door, bullets and a chess set are seen in a video released by the Israeli military of the passageway deep underground where it said six slain hostages were held and killed by Hamas.
articles.title: Israel shares video of cramped, bloody tunnel where hostages were held and killed

articles.author: Michelle Nichols
articles.description: A convoy of clearly marked armored U.N. vehicles in Gaza was encircled and held at gunpoint on Monday by Israeli forces seeking to question two of the U.N. staff, the United Nations said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Shots fired, bulldozers rammed cars during UN standoff with Israeli military

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Typhoon Yagi and the landslides and floods it triggered have killed at least 58 people and 40 others are missing in northern Vietnam, the disaster management agency said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Death toll in Vietnam from Typhoon Yagi rises to 58
